[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The Factory Management System (FMS) defines requirements for managing factory machines, workers, production, and orders.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: FMS supports machine tracking, workforce management, and order processing.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: FMS integrates with inventory, scheduling, CRM, and IoT systems.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: FMS allows managers and workers to oversee production and orders.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: FMS supports workstations, barcode scanners, and IoT devices.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: FMS uses PostgreSQL, MongoDB, REST APIs, and OAuth 2.0.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 Communications Interfa: FMS secures data via TLS encryption and access control.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 Memory Constraints: FMS is optimized for real-time data processing.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.7 Operations: FMS manages machines, workers, and orders.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.8 Site Adaptation Requir: FMS is configurable for factory layouts.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: FMS connects with maintenance tools, suppliers, and compliance databases.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: FMS tracks machines, workers, production, and orders.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: FMS is designed for managers, operators, and planners.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: FMS requires updated machine and worker data.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: FMS relies on accurate schedules and maintenance logs.
[SUBSEC] 1.8 Definitions: Machine: Factory equipment used in production.
Worker: Employee assigned to factory tasks.
Product: Manufactured item in the production process.

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall manage machine, worker, and order records (REQ-DB-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-002: The system shall track production status, materials, and quality metrics (REQ-DB-002).

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-001: The system shall manage worker assignments, machine operations, and shift scheduling, generating alerts for pending shifts (REQ-DB-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-002: The system shall track client orders, including status, delivery, and associated production schedules (REQ-DB-002).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-003: The system shall log machine performance, maintenance, and downtime, generating alerts for failures (REQ-DB-003).

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The system shall provide an interface for managing production workflows.

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall update logs and order statuses in real-time.
[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-002: The system shall process maintenance requests promptly.

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The system shall store machine, worker, shift, and order records.
[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-002: The system shall track production, materials, and performance history.

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall ensure unique identification for machines, workers, and orders.

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall comply with safety and labor regulations.

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall maintain logs for audits and compliance.

[SEC] 3. Verification: Tests machine tracking, worker scheduling, production, and order fulfillment.
[SEC] 4. Supporting Information: User manuals, API documentation, and compliance guidelines.
[SEC] 5. References: Factory safety laws, maintenance policies, and automation standards.
